topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Community Installation Overview

body.p: HPE Helion OpenStack Community is installed using TripleO which uses three linked installation phases to deploy a complete OpenStack cloud.

li.p: Seed - The seed VM is started as a VM from a specific seed VM image. It contains a number of self-contained OpenStack components that are used to deploy the undercloud. The seed deploys the undercloud by using the HPE Ironic service to deploy a specific undercloud machine image.

Undercloud - The undercloud is a complete OpenStack installation, which is then used to deploy the overcloud. In HPE Helion OpenStack Community, the undercloud can be a separate baremetal server or a virtual machine on the Seed host.
Overcloud - The overcloud is the end-user OpenStack cloud. In HPE Helion OpenStack Community, the undercloud can be separate baremetal servers or virtual machines on the Seed host.

body.p: With HPE Helion OpenStack Community, you can quickly and easily spin up clouds using two types of installation paths:

ul.li: A virtual installation for testing and proof-of-concept use. In the virtual installation, TripleO simulates the deployment of OpenStack by creating and configuring a set of virtual machines (VMs) that play the roles that baremetal machines would in a non-cloud deployment.

A multi-node, barmetal installation for small-scale production. For the baremetal installation, you will need to have available enough baremetal servers to accommodate your installation, as described in Community Hardware and Software Requirements.
